resources.string: Your nickname will be shown next to any content you post. You can\'t change it after creating your account.

Your Briar account is stored encrypted on your device, not in the cloud. If you forget your password or uninstall Briar, there\'s no way to recover your account.\n\nChoose a long password that\'s hard to guess, such as four random words, or ten random letters, numbers and symbols.
To receive messages, Briar needs to stay connected in the background.
To receive messages, Briar needs to stay connected in the background. Please disable battery optimizations so Briar can stay connected.
Please tap the button below and make sure Briar is protected in the \"Protected Apps\" screen.
If Briar is not added to the protected apps list, it will be unable to run in the background.
Please tap the button below, open the \"App launch\" screen and make sure Briar is set to \"Manage manually\".
If Briar is not set to \"Manage manually\" in the \"App launch\" screen, it will not be able to run in the background.
To run in the background, Briar needs to be locked to the recent apps list.
If Briar is not locked to the recent apps list, it will be unable to run in the background.

1. Open the recent apps list (also called the app switcher)

2. Swipe down on the image of Briar to show the padlock icon

3. If the padlock is not locked, tap to lock it

1. Open the recent apps list (also called the app switcher)

2. If Briar has a small image of a padlock next to its name then you don't need to do anything

3. If there's no padlock, press and hold the image of Briar until the padlock button appears, then tap it
Please tap the button below to open the security settings. Tap \"Boost speed\", then tap \"Lock apps\", and make sure Briar is set to \"Locked\".
If Briar is not set to \"Locked\" in the \"Lock apps\" screen, it will be unable to run in the background.
Briar was unable to run in the background
Briar cannot check your password. Please try rebooting your device to solve this problem.

Your Briar account is stored encrypted on your device, not in the cloud, so we can\'t reset your password. Would you like to delete your account and start again?\n\nCaution: Your identities, contacts and messages will be permanently lost.
Briar was unable to start because your device\'s clock is wrong.\n\nPlease set your device\'s clock to the right time and try again.

Briar was unable to open the database containing your account, your contacts and your messages.\n\nPlease upgrade to the latest version of the app and try again, or set up a new account by choosing \'I have forgotten my password\' at the password prompt.

Your account was created with an old version of this app and cannot be opened with this version.\n\nYou must either reinstall the old version or set up a new account by choosing \'I have forgotten my password\' at the password prompt.
Your account was created with a newer version of this app and cannot be opened with this version.\n\nPlease upgrade to the latest version and try again.
Briar was unable to start a required component.\n\nPlease upgrade to the latest version of the app and try again.

plurals.name: expiry_warning
plurals.item: This is a test version of Briar. Your account will expire in %d day and cannot be renewed.
This is a test version of Briar. Your account will expire in %d days and cannot be renewed.

plurals.name: old_android_expiry_warning
plurals.item: Android 4 is no longer supported. Briar will stop working on %s (in %d day). Please install Briar on a newer device and create a new account.
Android 4 is no longer supported. Briar will stop working on %s (in %d days). Please install Briar on a newer device and create a new account.

resources.string: This software has expired.\nThank you for testing!
To continue using Briar, please download the latest release.
You will need to create a new account, but you can use the same nickname.
Briar no longer runs on Android 4.\nPlease install Briar on a newer device.
You can tap the button below to delete your account from this device.
Tap here to control how Briar connects to your contacts.
Your phone has Internet access via Wi-Fi
Your phone has Internet access via mobile data
Your phone does not have Internet access
Briar is connecting to the Internet
Briar is connected to the Internet
Briar can\'t connect to the Internet
Briar is configured not to use the Internet
Briar is configured not to use mobile data
Briar is configured not to use the Internet when running on battery
Briar is configured not to use the Internet in this country
Your phone is connected to Wi-Fi
Your phone is not connected to Wi-Fi
Briar is connecting to the Wi-Fi network
Briar is connected to the Wi-Fi network
Briar can\'t connect to the Wi-Fi network
Briar is configured not to use the Wi-Fi network
Your phone\'s Bluetooth is turned on
Your phone\'s Bluetooth is turned off
Briar is configured not to use Bluetooth
The entered text is too long
Tap the + icon to add a contact
Image too big. Limit is %d MB.
Since you started composing your message, disappearing messages have been enabled.
Since you started composing your message, disappearing messages have been disabled.
Are you sure that you want to delete all messages?
Messages related to ongoing invitations and introductions cannot be deleted until they conclude.
Messages related to ongoing introductions cannot be deleted until they conclude.
Messages related to ongoing invitations cannot be deleted until they conclude.
To delete an invitation or introduction, you need to select the request and the response.
To delete an introduction, you need to select the request and the response.
To delete an invitation, you need to select the request and the response.
Are you sure that you want to remove this contact and all messages exchanged with this contact?
Saving this image will allow other apps to access it.\n\nAre you sure you want to save?
Your contact\'s Briar does not yet support image attachments. Once they upgrade you\'ll see a different icon.
You can now send images to this contact
Tap this icon to attach images.
Only the first %d images will be sent
You must meet up with the person you want to add as a contact.\n\nThis will prevent anyone from impersonating you or reading your messages in future.
Waiting for contact to scan and connect\u2026
The QR code you have scanned comes from an older version of Briar.\n\nPlease ask your contact to upgrade to the latest version and then try again.
The QR code you have scanned comes from a newer version of Briar.\n\nPlease upgrade to the latest version and then try again.
Could not connect to your contact
If this problem persists, please send feedback to help us improve the app.
Also insert the link of the contact here, only after both links have been exchanged, the connection will be established
Give your contact a nickname. Only you can see it.
Give this link to the contact you want to add
There was an error adding the contact.
Waiting for contact to come online…
This contact is still being added. If you remove it now, it will not be added.
Enter your contact\'s link, not your own
This link comes from a newer version of Briar. Please upgrade to the latest version and try again.
You opened your own link. Use the one of the contact you want to add!
You already have a pending contact with this link: %s
You already have a contact with this link: %s

%1$s and %2$s sent you the same link.

One of them may be trying to discover who your contacts are.

Don't tell them you received the same link from someone else.
Introduce your contacts to each other so they can connect on Briar.
You already have one introduction in progress with these contacts. Please allow for this to finish first. If you or your contacts are rarely online, this can take some time.
There was an error making the introduction.
You have asked to introduce %1$s to %2$s.
%1$s has asked to introduce you to %2$s. Do you want to add %2$s to your contact list?
%1$s has asked to introduce you to %2$s, but %2$s is already in your contact list. Since %1$s might not know that, you can still respond:
%1$s has asked to introduce you to %2$s.
Before %1$s gets added to your contacts, they need to accept the introduction as well. This might take some time.
The introduction to %1$s was automatically declined.

In case Bluetooth connections do not work automatically, you can use this screen to connect manually.

Your contact needs to be nearby for this to work.

You and your contact should both press "Start" at the same time.
Already trying to connect via Bluetooth. Please try again shortly.
Bluetooth is not supported by device.
Tap the + icon to create a group, or ask your contacts to share groups with you
Choose a name for your private group
Are you sure that you want to leave this group?
Are you sure that you want to dissolve this group?\n\nAll other members will not be able to continue their conversation and might not receive the latest messages.
The creator of this group has dissolved it.\n\nYou can no longer write messages to the group and might not receive all posts that have been written.
You have invited %1$s to join the group \"%2$s\".
%1$s has invited you to join the group \"%2$s\".
You accepted the group invitation from %s.
You declined the group invitation from %s.
The group invitation from %s was automatically declined.
Only the creator can invite new members to the group. Below are all current members of the group.

You can choose whether to reveal contacts to all current and future members of this group.\n\nRevealing contacts makes your connection to the group faster and more reliable, because you can communicate with revealed contacts even when the creator of the group is offline.
Contact relationship is visible to the group
Contact relationship is visible to the group (revealed by you)
Contact relationship is visible to the group (revealed by %s)
Contact relationship is not visible to the group
Tap the + icon to create a forum, or ask your contacts to share forums with you
Choose a name for your forum
Are you sure that you want to leave this forum?\n\nAny contacts you\'ve shared this forum with might stop receiving updates.
Please come back here after adding a contact
There was an error sharing this forum.
%1$s has shared the forum \"%2$s\" with you.
You have shared the forum \"%1$s\" with %2$s.
You accepted an invitation to this forum already.\n\nAccepting more invitations will make your connection to the forum faster and more reliable.
You accepted the forum invitation from %s.
You declined the forum invitation from %s.
The forum invitation from %s was automatically declined.
Any member of a forum can share it with their contacts. You are sharing this forum with the following contacts. There may also be other members who you can\'t see.
Posts from your contacts and blogs you subscribe to will appear here\n\nTap the pen icon to write a post

Are you sure that you want to remove this blog?

Posts will be removed from your device but not from other people's devices.

Any contacts you've shared this blog with might stop receiving updates.
There was an error sharing this blog.
You accepted the blog invitation from %s.
You declined the blog invitation from %s.
The blog invitation from %s was automatically declined.
%1$s has shared the blog \"%2$s\" with you.
You have shared the blog \"%1$s\" with %2$s.
Anyone who subscribes to a blog can share it with their contacts. You are sharing this blog with the following contacts. There may also be other subscribers who you can\'t see.
Enter the URL of the RSS feed
We are sorry! There was an error importing your feed.

Are you sure that you want to remove this feed?

Posts will be removed from your device but not from other people's devices.

Any contacts you've shared this feed with might stop receiving updates.
No RSS feeds to show\n\nTap the + icon to import a feed
There was a problem loading your feeds. Please try again later.
Tap to change your profile picture
Only your contacts can see this picture
We\'re sorry, but something went wrong while updating your profile picture
This setting will take effect when you restart Briar. Please sign out and restart Briar.
Connect to contacts on the same Wi-Fi network
Connect to contacts via the Internet
All connections go through the Tor network for privacy
Connect to the Internet only when charging
Disables Internet connection when device is running on battery
Use the device\'s screen lock to protect Briar while signed in
To use this feature, set up a screen lock for your device
When not using Briar, automatically lock it after %s
Configure how Briar will react when you use a panic button app
Are you sure that you want to allow %1$s to trigger destructive panic button actions?
Sign out of Briar if a panic button is pressed
Delete your Briar account if a panic button is pressed. Caution: This will permanently delete your identities, contacts and messages
Show a reminder when the phone starts or the app has been updated

A Mailbox enables your contacts to send you messages while you are offline. The Mailbox will receive your messages and store them until you come online.\n \nYou can install the Briar Mailbox app on a spare device. Keep it connected to power and Wi-Fi so it\'s always online.

First, install the Mailbox app on another device by searching for \"Briar Mailbox\" on Google Play or wherever you downloaded Briar.\n \nThen link your Mailbox with Briar by scanning the QR code shown by the Mailbox app.
You have denied access to the camera, but scanning a QR code requires using the camera.\n\nPlease consider granting access.
The scanned code is invalid. Please open the Briar Mailbox app on your Mailbox device and scan the QR code it presents.
Unlink the Mailbox on your other device and try again.
Ensure that both devices are connected to the Internet and try again.
Please send feedback (with anonymous data) via the Briar app if the issue persists.
Could not access camera. Try again, maybe after rebooting device.
Your Mailbox has been successfully linked with Briar.\n \nKeep your Mailbox connected to power and Wi-Fi so it\'s always online.
Ensure that this device is online and connections to the Internet are allowed.\n \nAfterwards, wait for the globe icon in the connection settings screen to turn green.
Briar is having trouble connecting to the Mailbox
Update Briar to the latest version of the app and try again.
Update your Mailbox to the latest version of the app and try again.
Are you sure you want to unlink your Mailbox?
If you unlink your Mailbox, you won\'t be able to receive messages while Briar is offline.

Next time you have access to your Mailbox device, please open the Mailbox app and tap the \"Unlink\" button to complete the process.\n\nIf you no longer have access to your Mailbox device, don\'t worry. Your data is encrypted so it will remain secure even if you don\'t complete the process.
Do you have access to your Mailbox device?
Yes, I have access to it right now.
Not right now, but I can get access to it later.
No, I no longer have access to it.
Check that the Mailbox device is turned on and connected to the Internet.
Open the Mailbox app. What do you see?
I see instructions for setting up the Mailbox
Please unlink your Mailbox using the button below, then follow the instructions on the Mailbox device to link it again.
Please unlink your Mailbox using the button below, then scan the QR code to link it again.

Please use the button below to check the connection between Briar and the Mailbox.

 If the connection fails again:
 • Check that the Mailbox and Briar apps are updated to the latest version.
 • Restart your Mailbox and Briar devices and try again.

Check that the mailbox device is properly connected to the Internet.

Check that the clock on the Mailbox device shows the right time, date and timezone.

Check that the Mailbox and Briar apps are updated to the latest version.

Restart your Mailbox and Briar devices and try again.
Please come back to this screen when you have access to the device.
Please unlink your mailbox using the button below.\n\nAfter unlinking your old Mailbox, you can set up a new Mailbox at any time.
Thanks to all the contributors at the Localization Lab

Turning on this setting will make new messages in this conversation automatically disappear after 7 days. 

The countdown for the sender's copy of the message starts after it has been delivered. The countdown starts for the recipient after they have read the message. 

Messages that will disappear are marked with a bomb icon. 

Keep in mind that recipients can still make copies of the messages you send. 

If you change this setting, it will apply to your new messages immediately and to your contact's messages once they receive your next message. Your contact can also change this setting for the both of you.
Make future messages in this conversation automatically disappear after 7\u00A0days.
You are about to open the following link with an external app.
This can be used to identify you. Think about whether you trust the person that sent you this link and consider opening it with Tor Browser.
Please help us build a better Briar by sending us a crash report.
We promise that the report is encrypted and sent securely.
By sending us data you agree to our privacy policy
Include anonymous data about the crash
Include anonymous data about this device
Report saved. It will be sent the next time you log into Briar.

Another app is drawing on top of Briar. To protect your security, Briar will not respond to touches when another app is drawing on top.

The following apps might be drawing on top:

%1$s
Another app is drawing on top of Briar. To protect your security, Briar will not respond to touches when another app is drawing on top.\n\nReview apps below to find the responsible app.
Allow these apps to draw on top
To scan the QR code, Briar needs access to the camera.
To discover Bluetooth devices, Briar needs permission to access your location.\n\nBriar does not store your location or share it with anyone.

To scan the QR code, Briar needs access to the camera.

To discover Bluetooth devices, Briar needs permission to access your location.

Briar does not store your location or share it with anyone.
You have denied access to the camera, but adding contacts requires using the camera.\n\nPlease consider granting access.
You have denied access to your location, but Briar needs this permission to discover Bluetooth devices.\n\nPlease consider granting access.
Your device\'s location setting must be turned on to find other devices via Bluetooth. Please enable location to continue. You can disable it again afterwards.
Enter your device PIN, pattern or password to unlock Briar
Touch your fingerprint sensor with the registered finger to continue

Briar can connect to your contacts via the Internet, Wi-Fi or Bluetooth.

All Internet connections go through the Tor network for privacy.

If a contact can be reached by multiple methods, Briar uses them in parallel.

Share this app with someone nearby without an Internet connection by using your phone\'s Wi-Fi. \n\nYour phone will start a Wi-Fi hotspot. People nearby can connect to the hotspot and download the Briar app from your phone.
To create a Wi-Fi hotspot, Briar needs permission to access your location.\n\nBriar does not store your location or share it with anyone.
You have denied access to your location, but Briar needs this permission to create a Wi-Fi hotspot.\n\nPlease consider granting access.
To create a Wi-Fi hotspot, Briar needs to use Wi-Fi. Please enable it.

Your phone is providing a Wi-Fi hotspot. People who want to download Briar can connect to the hotspot by adding it in their device\'s Wi-Fi settings using the details below or by %s. When they have connected to the hotspot, press \'Next\'.
Your phone is providing a Wi-Fi hotspot. People who want to download Briar can connect to the hotspot by scanning this QR code. When they have connected to the hotspot, press \'Next\'.
Your phone is providing a Wi-Fi hotspot. People who are connected to the hotspot can download Briar by typing the following link in a web browser or %s.
Your phone is providing a Wi-Fi hotspot. People who are connected to the hotspot can download Briar by scanning this QR code.
Someone nearby shared Briar with you.
After the download is complete, open the downloaded file and install it.
If you cannot download the app, try it with a different web browser app.

To install the downloaded app, you might need to allow installation of apps from \"Unknown sources\" in system settings. Afterwards, you may need to download the app again. We recommend disabling the \"Unknown sources\" setting after installing the app.
To install the downloaded app, you might need to allow your browser to install unknown apps. After installing the app, we recommend removing the browser\'s permission to install unknown apps.
Try disabling and re-enabling Wi-Fi on both phones and try again.
If your phone complains that the Wi-Fi has no Internet, tell it that you want to stay connected anyway.
Restart the phone which is running the Wi-Fi hotspot, then start Briar and try sharing again.
Double check that you entered the address exactly as shown. A small error can make it fail.
Ensure that your phone is still connected to the correct Wi-Fi (see above) when you try to access the site.
If you have a firewall app, check that it isn\'t blocking access.
If you can visit the site, but not download the Briar app, try it with a different web browser app.

You can try to save the app as an .apk file to share in some other way. Once the file has been transferred to the other device, it can be used to install Briar. \n\nTip: For sharing via Bluetooth, you might need to rename the file to end with .zip first.
Something went wrong while trying to share the app via Wi-Fi:
Device does not support Wi-Fi Direct
Hotspot failed to start with an unknown error, reason %d
Hotspot failed to start: no group info
Error presenting website.\n\nPlease send feedback (with anonymous data) via the Briar app if the issue persists.
Warning: This app was installed with Android Studio and can NOT be installed on another device.
Unable to start the hotspot.\n\nIf you have another hotspot running or are sharing your Internet connection via Wi-Fi, try stopping that and try again afterwards.
If you can\'t connect to your contact via the Internet, Wi-Fi or Bluetooth, Briar can also transfer messages on a removable drive such as a USB stick or an SD card.

If you can't connect to your contact via the Internet, Wi-Fi or Bluetooth, Briar can also transfer messages on a removable drive such as a USB stick or an SD card.

When you use the "Send Data" button, any data that's waiting to be sent to the contact will be written to the removable drive. This includes private messages, attachments, blogs, forums and private groups.

Everything will be encrypted before it is written to the removable drive.

When your contact receives the removable drive, they can use the "Receive Data" button to import the messages into Briar.
Tap the button below to create a new file containing the encrypted messages. You can choose where the file will be saved.\n\nIf you want to save the file on a removable drive, insert the drive now.
There are currently no messages waiting to be sent to this contact.
This contact is using an old version of Briar or an old device which does not support this feature.
Please wait for ongoing task to complete
Tap the button below to choose the file that your contact sent you.\n\nIf the file is on a removable drive, insert the drive now.

Data exported successfully. You now have 28 days to transport the file to your contact.\n\nIf the file is on a removable drive, use the notification in the status bar to eject the drive before unplugging it.
All encrypted messages contained in this file have been received.

There was an error writing data to the file.

If you are using a removable drive, ensure that it is properly inserted and try again.

If the error persists, please send feedback to let the Briar team know about the issue.

The selected file did not contain anything that Briar could recognize.

Please check that you chose the right file.

If your contact created the file more than 28 days ago, Briar will not be able to recognize it.
Hi Alice! Thanks for telling me about Briar!
No problem, hope you like it 😀
